page.title: 01Metfield and St James
page.content: South Elmham. The land in this area is mostly flat. A tributary of the river Waveney forms a dale running westwards from the village of Metfield. Trees and hedges were removed in the eastern sector when a WW II Airfield was built, as result this section is very open. Due to fertile clay soils the whole area is under intensive arable management. Other farming enterprises include piggeries, chicken rearing, also some dairying. Metfield has a population of 335 and for a rural village has several services. St James, a smaller village, does not have many amenities, but for a village of its size its an impressve street lighting system. There is little industry, some of those not invovled in agriculture work as builders, vehicle breaks and potters.
